SafetyInspectionBy: Stanislaus County Dept. of Environmental Resources

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
CCIDENT HISTORY
Saputo Cheese USA Inc.- Newman has had a good record of preventing accidental releases over the last five years.  Due to our release prevention policies, no incidents, as defined by the RMP rule, have occurred in the past five years.

5. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
Saputo Cheese USA Inc.- Newman developed an Emergency Response Plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials as well as other emergency events that might occur at the plant. The purpose of Saputo's Emergency Response Plan is to ensure employees know and understand what to do in the event of an emergency to minimize injuries and property damage. The plan includes various aspects of an emergency including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, and notification of local emergency response agencies. Saputo Cheese - Newman has a team that is trained in HAZWOPER Operations and 24-hour spill technician levels. Those trained to the spill technician level have been instructed in the use of Level C protection. Specific employees are also trained and certified as medical responders. All employees are trained in evacuation, hazard communication, and chemical safety. In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect pertinent changes.
 
6. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
Several developments and findings have resulted from the implementation of the various elements of our accidental release prevention program. Recommendations resulting from the PHA, compliance audits, seismic assessments and mechanical integrity inspections will be addressed in a timely manner. In addition, regular interaction with Saputo Corporate - Department of Refrigeration Services, Health & Safety and Risk Group and the Department of Environmental Affairs will improve compliance and overall plant safety.

RMP Executive Summary


1. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION & EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
Saputo is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is inherent to a comprehensive accidental release prevention program in place that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.  If such a release does occur, our employees are trained to follow the Emergency Response Plan and to evacuate the facility as necessary. We are also coordinated with the Stanislaus County CUPA which provides additional emergency response expertise.

2. FACILITY INFORMATION & REGULATED SUBSTANCES
The Saputo Cheese USA Inc. - Newman facility is located at 691 Inyo Street in Newman, California,
approximately two blocks east of State Highway 33. The plant's primary products include packaged
provolone and mozzarella cheese for the wholesale and retail markets and liquid Whey processing.
The facility employs approximately 135 full-time employees. There is one RMP-regulated substance,
anhydrous ammonia, used in the plant's refrigeration system to provide refrigeration for processing
and cold storage of dairy food products. This system contains 13,128 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia.
 
3. GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM & CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
The Saputo Cheese USA Inc.- Newman plant follows the California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program as the release prevention program for the EPA RMP. In addition, Saputo Corporate - Department of Refrigeration Services works with the plant confirming regulatory and corporate standards are being followed, providing guidance and standardization on the RMP, OSHA PSM and CalARP programs and acting as a resource for the plant on the RMP, PSM, CalARP and other environmental programs.
